data.title: ASCII ASCII ASCII
data.solution:
text=input()

previous_text = ''
nt = 0
while True:
    previous_text = str(sum(ord(c) for c in text))
    if text==previous_text:
        break
    text = previous_text
    nt += 1

print(nt)
data.statement:
When playing multiple clashes, it sometimes feels as if you are in a loop of ASCII value requests...

Starting with [[text]], you must take the sum of the decimal ASCII values of all characters. Of this outcome, you must take the sum of the decimal ASCII values of all digits. And of that one again, ..., until you end up at a number that equals the sum of the decimal ASCII values of its own digits. Output the <<number of times>> [[nt]] you had to take the sum until you ended up at a number that equals the sum of its digits' ASCII value.

<<Example:>> For text {{OK}}, the sum of decimal ASCII values of {{O}} and {{K}} is 79 + 75 = 154. For this outcome, the sum of decimal ASCII values of {{1}} , {{5}} and {{4}} is 49 + 53 + 52 = 154 --> the same number. It took [[nt]]=1 time to end up at the final number, output {{1}}.

testCases.title: Longer text
testCases.testIn: Some ASCII characters are %,$,# and @. And of course ( and ) as well.

data.inputDescription: [[text]]: a string of ASCII printable characters.
data.outputDescription: Integer [[nt]]: number of times it takes until a value is reached of which the sum of its digits' ASCII value is the same as itself.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

When playing multiple clashes, it sometimes feels as if you are in a loop of ASCII value requests...

Starting with text, you must take the sum of the decimal ASCII values of all characters. Of this outcome, you must take the sum of the decimal ASCII values of all digits. And of that one again, ..., until you end up at a number that equals the sum of the decimal ASCII values of its own digits. Output the number of times nt you had to take the sum until you ended up at a number that equals the sum of its digits' ASCII value.

Example: For text OK, the sum of decimal ASCII values of O and K is 79 + 75 = 154. For this outcome, the sum of decimal ASCII values of 1 , 5 and 4 is 49 + 53 + 52 = 154 --> the same number. It took nt=1 time to end up at the final number, output 1.
Input
text: a string of ASCII printable characters.
Output
Integer nt: number of times it takes until a value is reached of which the sum of its digits' ASCII value is the same as itself.
Constraints
Length of text<100
Example
Input
OK
Output
1
